title: Isoperimetric inequality
summary: In mathematics, the isoperimetric inequality is a geometric inequality involving the perimeter of a set and its volume. In n {\displaystyle n} -dimensional space R n {\displaystyle \mathbb {R} ^{n}} the inequality lower bounds the surface area or perimeter per ⁡ ( S ) {\displaystyle \operatorname {per} (S)} of a set S ⊂ R n {\displaystyle S\subset \mathbb {R} ^{n}} by its volume vol ⁡ ( S ) {\displaystyle \operatorname {vol} (S)} ,
